Used to delete a device.
When a request is received from the network to delete a device, NCC checks whether there are any active sessions (Gy, IMS, SMS, MMS, Sy, IMS, or 5G) for the device.
If there are no active sessions: The device is deleted.
If there are active sessions: First, the units reserved for such sessions are de-allocated. Then the sessions are deleted and then the device is deleted. NCC does not send any update to the requesting network/PCRF via ASR, STR, or RAR messages for the device/session deletion. If the network sends further CCR(T) or CCR(U) requests, then an error or alarm is generated for the update/termination of the non-existing session. In case of co-resident policy and charging, policy behavior for device deletion remains unchanged.

note.p: These actions are valid for internal purposes only. It is not accessible through the SM GUI for operators.
